sections.installation:
üöÄ Follow these steps to install and start using the plugin:

  1. Download the plugin from the WordPress plugin directory or upload the testimonials-for-everyone folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.
  3. Create a new page or post, click the “+” button in the Gutenberg editor to add a block, and search for “Testimonials for Everyone”.
  4. Customize the testimonial block using the available settings (layout, colors, borders, sorting options, etc.).
  5. Publish the page or post, and the testimonials will be live on your site!
sections.faq:
‚ùì How do I add a testimonials block to a page or post?

You can add a testimonials block by going to the Gutenberg editor, clicking the “+” button, and searching for “Testimonials for Everyone”. Select the block, and you can then add and customize your testimonials.

üîÑ Can I sort testimonials?

Yes! You can easily change the order of testimonials by dragging and dropping them within the block editor or by manually setting the display order using the “Testimonial Order” setting.

üé® Can I customize the style of the testimonials?

Yes! You can adjust the background color, border size, star size, text alignment, and much more using the Gutenberg block settings. This allows you to ensure the testimonials match your site’s design and brand.

‚≠ê Can I display star ratings for each testimonial?

Absolutely! You can enable star ratings within the block settings and customize the star color, size, and alignment to suit your needs.

üñºÔ∏è Can I choose different layouts for displaying testimonials?

Yes! You can choose from multiple layouts such as grid, list, or slider to best display your testimonials.

üë§ Can I show or hide the author image, company name, and other details?

Yes, the plugin gives you full control over what to display. You can choose to show or hide the author name, company, image, rating, and even add a link to the author‚Äôs website.

üí¨ How do I manage my testimonials?

You can easily manage testimonials directly in the Gutenberg editor. Just click on the testimonials block within the page or post, and you can add, edit, sort, or delete testimonials from there.

üöÄ How does the plugin perform on mobile devices?

The plugin is fully responsive and optimized for mobile devices, ensuring your testimonials look great on screens of all sizes.

üõ†Ô∏è Where can I find the uncompressed source code for JavaScript and CSS files?

You can find the uncompressed source code in the admin/js/ and admin/css/ directories inside the plugin.

üöÄ How do I build the compressed JavaScript and CSS files?

  1. Ensure you have Node.js installed.
  2. Navigate to the plugin’s root directory in your terminal.
  3. Run npm install to install the necessary dependencies.
  4. Run npm run build to generate the compressed files using Webpack.

This will create the minified files used in production, which are located in the admin/js/dist/ directory.
